column4: I only have an 9.04 live cd but I'm on karmic could I fsck with that?
ActionParsnip, I think you can. because you can create ext4 on jaunty
dont fsck a mounted partition
do you want to recover grub?
sudo e2fsck -fyvD /dev/devicename
ensure that you dont fsck a mounted partition, please
I was told by experienced guys that it is not generally safe to fsck a partition while it is mounted unless you know what you are doing.
are you using GRUB2 or Grub Legacy?
you are on karmic
you are using ubuntu 9.10?
you are probably using grub2, I don't understand why you once mentioned anything about menu.lst
try to disable the splash screen and make ubuntu to print boot messages if you can
pastebin any relevant boot messages so we can have a clue
codecs?
can you boot on recovery mode?
boot on recovery mode, and do a CTRL+D do procede to the normal runlevel
is your ubuntu system contained in one big partition or you have separate partitions that you have to mount?
oh,
tty1 of your ubuntu system or of the liveCD?
what happens when you do a CTRL+D, are you going to go to a gdm screen and be able to log in fine?
I really do not know
